message: Does anyone use gvim while using an Amazon EC2 instance?  I'm having issues getting it to display on my laptop.  I connect to EC2 using SecureCRT (an SSH client).  I have an X Windows server program named Xming running on my laptop.  I've been trying to run gvim and have it display on my laptop, but haven't gotten it to work.  X11 forwarding is enabled, I set the DISPLAY variable in EC2 and also ran "xhost +" for my X Windows server.  I'm doing something wrong, but not sure.  If anyone has ideas, I'd appreciate help.   (I know it would be better to post this in an EC2 group, but I noticed those have very little members and usage)
Do you really need to run Xorg on an EC2? that's crazy!
agreed @myfreeweb ... you're denying yourself one of the big benefits of knowing vim: needing nothing other than an ssh connection to edit comfortably.
why don't you install your public key on the instance and edit from your local gvim with scp?
@odwyerrob Thanks for the suggestion about git/rsync.  I'll give those a try.
or even better, use git or rsync to sync a local folder with your instance - just map a key to push/sync every so often. that way you avoid the delay when saving
Mount sftp (eg. expandrive) and edit with your local vim like everything's local, eg. mvim /Volumes/vds9.wm.ru/usr/home/user1/redis.conf
Seconded. Just use bog standard vim on the server? Why tunnel x to it?
@myfreeweb It's beside the point, but no need for Expandrive to edit over SCP with vim -- see :help netrw
@ches, mounting sftp is cooler, you use it like a local drive and stuff is synced in the background
